summary: Phase 4: integrate a conversational 'Secretary' layer to manage tasks via intents.
architectural_notes: Secretary layer will use explicit intents (create_task, find_tasks, update_task) to route task actions to backend APIs.

existing_features.title: Extend the Secretary intent type system to include three new intents: create_task, find_tasks, and update_task.

Add task-related slot definitions required to fulfill the new task intents, including at minimum: task title, task description, task category, location identifier, and task identifier (for updates). Ensure an empty slot bag can be created and slot fill/clear checks work for the new slots.

Update the rule-based intent classifier to recognize the new intents from common user phrasing (e.g., “create a task”, “show tasks”, “find tasks”, “update task”, “mark task done”), without breaking existing intents.
Register the new intents in the intent flow registry with required/optional slots and a slot fill order, and define completion behavior hooks for each intent.

Add English slot-filling prompts for the new task slots so the Secretary can ask for missing task information during an intent flow (e.g., ask for title, description, location, category, and which task to update).

Integrate the task intent system into the Secretary runtime so task intents are actually executed from chat input: when user text is received, classify to a task intent when appropriate, run slot-filling using the intent flow runner, and on completion call the existing task backend methods via the current actor (createTask, listTasksByLocation, getTask/updateTask) and present a short English confirmation/result message in the Secretary chat.

new_feature_requests.summary: Secretary integration: add intents create_task, find_tasks, update_task to connect conversational commands to the task backend

projectName: Phase 4 Secretary integration: add task intents (create_task, find_tasks, update_task)
